name: unconvincingly
content:

in a way that does not seem true or real: Various ministers claimed, unconvincingly, that they were not worried. "I was not nervous, just tense," he said, unconvincingly. See
unconvincing
More examplesFewer examplesThe prime minister denied recently, and rather unconvincingly, that there was any problem."I love to lift weights," he says, somewhat unconvincingly.The team has struggled unconvincingly for much of the season.
